param.name: type
param.para: The type of audio object to activate. For dynamic audio objects, this value must be AudioObjectType_Dynamic. For static audio objects, specify one of the static audio channel values from the enumeration. Specifying AudioObjectType_None will produce an audio object that is not spatialized.

param.name: audioObject
param.para: Receives a pointer to the activated interface.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

description.para: The maximum number of simultaneous spatial audio objects has been exceeded. Call on unused audio objects before attempting to activate additional objects.
The static channel specified in the type parameter was not included in the StaticObjectTypeMask field of the passed into .
A spatial audio object has already been activated for the static channel specified in the type parameter.
The value specified in the type parameter is not one of the values defined by the enumeration.
The associated with the spatial audio stream has been destroyed.
The audio endpoint device has been unplugged, or the audio hardware or associated hardware resources have been reconfigured, disabled, removed, or otherwise made unavailable for use.
The media associated with the spatial audio stream uses an unsupported format.

remarks.para: A dynamic is one that was activated by setting the type parameter to the ActivateSpatialAudioObjectForMetadataCommands method to AudioObjectType_Dynamic. The client has a limit of the maximum number of dynamic spatial audio objects that can be activated at one time. After the limit has been reached, attempting to activate additional audio objects will result in this method returning an SPTLAUDCLNT_E_NO_MORE_OBJECTS error. To avoid this, call on each dynamic ISpatialAudioObjectForMetadataCommands after it is no longer being used to free up the resource so that it can be reallocated. See and for more information on the managing the lifetime of spatial audio objects.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of audio object to activate. For dynamic audio objects, this value must be AudioObjectType_Dynamic. For static audio objects, specify one of the static audio channel values from the enumeration. Specifying AudioObjectType_None will produce an audio object that is not spatialized.

param.name: audioObject
param.para: Receives a pointer to the activated interface.

description.para: The maximum number of simultaneous spatial audio objects has been exceeded. Call on unused audio objects before attempting to activate additional objects.
The static channel specified in the type parameter was not included in the StaticObjectTypeMask field of the passed into .
A spatial audio object has already been activated for the static channel specified in the type parameter.
The value specified in the type parameter is not one of the values defined by the enumeration.
The associated with the spatial audio stream has been destroyed.
The audio endpoint device has been unplugged, or the audio hardware or associated hardware resources have been reconfigured, disabled, removed, or otherwise made unavailable for use.
The media associated with the spatial audio stream uses an unsupported format.

remarks.para: A dynamic is one that was activated by setting the type parameter to the ActivateSpatialAudioObjectForMetadataItems method to AudioObjectType_Dynamic. The client has a limit of the maximum number of dynamic spatial audio objects that can be activated at one time. After the limit has been reached, attempting to activate additional audio objects will result in this method returning an SPTLAUDCLNT_E_NO_MORE_OBJECTS error. To avoid this, call on each dynamic ISpatialAudioObjectForMetadataItems after it is no longer being used to free up the resource so that it can be reallocated. See and for more information on the managing the lifetime of spatial audio objects.

summary.para: Provides methods for controlling a spatial audio object render stream for metadata, including starting, stopping, and resetting the stream. Also provides methods for activating new and instances and notifying the system when you are beginning and ending the process of updating activated spatial audio objects and data.
This interface is a part of Windows Sonic, Microsoft’s audio platform for more immersive audio which includes integrated spatial sound on Xbox and Windows.

remarks.para: Note Many of the methods provided by this interface are implemented in the inherited interface.
